metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24889 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability in LibRaw version < 20.0 LibRaw::GetNormalizedModel in src/metadata/normalize_model.cpp may lead to context-dependent arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24889` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> affected code was introduced in 20.0, and is not present in versions earlier than that, contrary to the CVE description See "Hasselblad L1D-20c, X1D II 50C" in https://www.libraw.org/news/libraw-0-20-Release

criterions.comment: libraw package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1ubuntu0.5').
